comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Our very first Bed Merchant? Do we think it's safe enough to dub this Mr Knox as James Knox? Arundel Square is a very specific area after all - or Anurdel Square as it says in the online census. I had hoped he might be something to do with the Joseph Knox shop on Barronstrand Street, but they were Hardware sellers...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] James Knox is 60 in 1901. Even if this shot is 1884, he would be 45. I don't think this gentleman is that old. I think this might be a son of James Knox who moved out between this photo and 1901.

This could well be Joseph Knox, who by 1901 is 29 and living as Head of his Own Family a stones throw away in Barronstrand Street (with just one servant for company!). He was born in Co. Kilkenny, like James Knox.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: I think James Knox's bed shop is now Jessica's in Streetview, which may have been where this Mr. Knox and his dog lived when the photo was taken.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Entering extremely speculative waters: here is a Poole photo of a wedding group for Mr. F Hearnshaw c/o Mrs. Knox, it's maybe 30 years later, and at right is a man with a tache and a high hairline, left-parted: is it our Mr. Knox in his 50s?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Last house on the left in this one? I think it says J. Knox - checked on Super Duper Hi Res, and it's deffo J. and could well be Knox...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: In that one, J. Nolan is in #3, which lines the numbers up with the census, so yes, I think the Knoxing shop (sorry :) is last on the left.
